text:
Fluminense de Feira Futebol Clube, usually known as Fluminense de Feira, or Touro, is a Brazilian football club from Feira de Santana, Bahia, Brazil, founded on January 1, 1941. The club was founded by a group of youngs who were fans of Rio de Janeiro's Fluminense, kept as nuclei of the namesake carioca.
Its home is the Joia da Princesa stadium, a municipal stadium also located in Feira de Santana, with people capacity 16,274, according to the national football stadium register (CNEF).
